examples: a medical examination is conducted without delay

noun.description: A formal test of a person's knowledge or proficiency in a particular subject or skill.
examples: he scraped through the examinations at the end of his first year

noun.description: The formal questioning of a witness in court.

origin: Late Middle English (also in the sense testing (one's conscience) by a standard): via Old French from Latin examinatio(n-), from examinare weigh, test (see examine).
